author: Jacob Fox
description: Asus ain't playing.
title: Asus just grabbed the fastest OLED crown with this 540/720 Hz dual mode beast of a monitor

author: Jacob Fox
description: Bye bye burn-in?
title: Asus' new monitor brings tandem OLED into the fray and promises brighter panels with a whopping 60% increased lifespan

author: Andy Chalk
description: Current and former Microsoft employees and other protesters briefly claimed a "Liberated Zone" in Microsoft's East Campus Plaza, before being dispersed by police.
title: Microsoft employees set up encampment at company headquarters to protest ongoing partnership with Israeli military in Gaza

author: Shaun Prescott
description: With the benefit of 120fps and crisper graphics, maybe it'll feel better in 2025.
title: Outlaws is a quirky '90s wild west FPS you probably never played, so naturally it's getting the Nightdive remaster treatment later this year

author: Morgan Park
description: Good news for getting mileage out of your Blops 6 gear, but bad news if you were hoping for a reset.
title: Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 braces for tidal wave of Beavis and Butthead as Activision announces Black Ops 6 skins will carry forward into the new game

author: Andy Chalk
description: Team Jade's new shooter was revealed during today's Opening Night Live event.
title: The new game from the makers of Delta Force looks like Hunt: Showdown moved to Silent Hill

author: Morgan Park
description: Activision is taking complaints "seriously," but not seriously enough to share any specific changes to the status quo.
title: As Battlefield 6 commits to 'keeping it grounded' with skins, Call of Duty director makes an unconvincing promise to 'calibrate' cosmetics in Black Ops 7

author: Christopher Livingston
description: Doesn't mean you can't crush, though.
title: Meet your snarky, sexy companions in The Outer Worlds 2: 'And no, you can't sleep with them'

author: Joshua Wolens
description: Enough of this cowardly tank gameplay we've been forced to endure.
title: Wargaming is making a new World of Tanks for the Overwatch generation: A tank-y hero shooter with 'heroic tank gameplay'

author: Christopher Livingston
description: It's a change from Season 1, so if you wanna binge the series in one go, you'll have to wait until February.
title: Important binge news: Fallout Season 2 will air one episode per week, instead of all at once

author: Andrea Shearon
description: There's that dreadfully familiar radio static.
title: Silent Hill F dials down the action just a bit for a new story focused trailer

author: Fraser Brown
description: Who's also a 1920s detective.
title: Vampire: The Masquerade – Bloodlines 2 is finally launching on October 21, and yes you'll technically be able to play as a Malkavian vampire

author: Andy Chalk
description: Zero Parades, as the new game is now officially known, sure sounds like Disco Elysium too.
title: Studio ZA/UM's Disco Elysium follow-up drops a reveal trailer at Gamescom, and boy it sure looks like Disco Elysium

author: Andrea Shearon
description: Don't worry, there's a Seikret and Chocobo there, too.
title: Final Fantasy XIV and Monster Hunter get together again for a crossover event swapping Omega and Arkveld

author: Christopher Livingston
description: The season begins December 17.
title: 'It started here, with one man': Fallout Season 2 teaser takes us to Vegas to meet Mr. House, gives us a glimpse of Caesar's Legion and a Deathclaw

author: Lincoln Carpenter
description: I'm not holding a grudge or anything.
title: There's a Sekiro anime coming to Crunchyroll so I can relive my shame of getting brutalized by Guardian Ape

author: Morgan Park
description: Wall jumps, co-op campaign, and the return of unlock challenges from Modern Warfare 3.
title: Activision just dropped a 17-minute Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 direct, here's what's in it

author: Fraser Brown
description: It's been 200 years but Cyrus is still fighting orks.
title: Dawn of War 4 is returning to Kronus with 4 playable factions, 4 campaigns, more than 70 missions and lots of base building

author: Andy Chalk
description: Swords of Legends, an upcoming new addition to the Gujian series, was revealed during today's Opening Night Live showcase at Gamescom.
title: For the first time ever, a new game in one of China's most popular videogame series will be released simultaneously in the West

author: Shaun Prescott
description: Valor Mortis is coming to PC in 2026.
title: Ghostrunner creators are back with a horror-infused alternate history of the Napoleonic wars—and the studio says it plays like a first-person soulslike

author: Lincoln Carpenter
description: I want to believe.
title: Denshattack is a game where you do Tony Hawk stunts with Japanese trains whose developers would not confirm whether I can make a train do a Christ Air

author: Andy Chalk
description: Developer Cloud Chamber has laid off an unknown number of employees as it moves to rework the game.
title: BioShock 4 studio lays off staff as former Diablo boss Rod Fergusson returns to get things back on track

author: Andy Chalk
description: As usual, preordering will get you in a few days early.
title: Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 beta test is set for October

author: Wes Fenlon
description: Join us for another deluge of World Premieres as we cover Geoff Keighley's Gamescom presentation live.
title: Gamescom Opening Night Live 2025: All the announcements in one place

description: Join us for another deluge of World Premieres as we cover Geoff Keighley's Gamescom presentation live.

author: Joshua Wolens
description: What a thrill.
title: Why we're still playing Metal Gear Solid after nearly 30 years

author: Jeremy Laird
description: An awful lot of engineering for such a small tool.
title: This adjustable Allen key tool is one small project for a YouTube channel, one giant leap for PC building kind

author: Harvey Randall
description: I… I don't know what to do with myself.
title: Team Cherry will be making a 'Special Announcement' about Silksong on Thursday, and—wait, is it finally over? Can we all go home?

author: Jacob Fox
description: Is this a sleeper GPU, then? Retro but hella powerful.
title: Call that ideal GPU physique? Nah, the 800 W 30th anniversary Asus ROG Matrix RTX 5090 is ideal GPU physique

author: Harvey Randall
description: Darnit.
title: Fallout creator Tim Cain does the impossible, makes me shift my opinion on respecs just a little bit, because fine, I guess it does sometimes turn bad design 'into a player problem'

author: Jess Kinghorn
description: Haha, I'm in danger.
title: Asus has announced even more Hatsune Miku-themed gaming gear, further leading me towards financial ruin

author: Jeremy Laird
description: All your games are belong to AI.
title: 87% of game developers are already using AI agents and over a third use AI for creative elements like level design and dialogue according to a new Google survey

author: Harvey Randall
description: No more heroes.
title: Marvel Rivals devs have been given the go-ahead to make their own characters for the game, and I have literally no idea why they'd do that

author: Mollie Taylor
description: I don't know either.
title: Well, skibidi is in the dictionary now

author: Mollie Taylor
description: Alongside some major visual overhauls.
title: Deadlock is drip-feeding 6 new heroes over the next couple of weeks, and is letting players decide which ones drop first

author: Harvey Randall
description: It's almost nostalgic.
title: NCSoft's making a new MMO shooter that, snazzy graphics aside, feels like it's already 15 years old—and that might just match your freak

author: Mollie Taylor
description: I, er, don't think this was the correct play.
title: 'Leaks are poison to all creation': Infinity Nikki developer asks very nicely to stop spilling all its upcoming outfits by gifting everyone a vaguely threatening hammer

author: Jeremy Laird
description: It could be correlation without causation, but holding off update KB5063878 for now probably makes sense.
title: A new report claims Windows 11 update is breaking SSDs and HDDs, but this could just be routine hardware failures

author: Nick Evanson
description: With a better screen and keyboard, this could have been Alienware's best-ever laptop.
title: Alienware 18 Area-51 (2025) review

author: Kara Phillips
description: A few changes to ease the pressure.
title: Disney Dreamlight Valley is making some significant changes to Star Paths ahead of its next update to make it more engaging for 'those who play week over week'

author: Rich Stanton
description: The spice must flow... but not beyond workspace regulations!
title: Dune Awakening promises an endgame overhaul and says communication has been bad because developers had 'state mandated' vacations

author: Harvey Randall
description: This time for sure.
title: Capcom runs out of emergency glass to break with Monster Hunter Wilds, but it's going to 'implement a multifaceted plan' to improve PC performance 'this winter'

author: Andy Edser
description: Suddenly Intel looks like hot property again.
title: Softbank announces it's buying a $2 billion stake in Intel as the Trump administration reportedly considers a 10% slice of the bright blue chipmaking pie

description: This is not quite the ultimate gaming monitor you've been waiting for.

description: All the Wordle help you could possibly need.
title: Today's Wordle clues, hints and answer for August 19 (#1522)

author: Ted Litchfield
description: Those crazy kids in Tokyo have done it again.
title: 15 attempts in, I actually love that Elden Ring Nightreign's Everdark Libra is the first FromSoftware boss who's harder to beat in co-op than solo

author: Shaun Prescott
description: BlackMill Games' latest will hit PC next year.
title: Not content with making three WW1 first-person shooters already, the creators of Verdun and Isonzo are now making a Gallipoli FPS
